title: Data Specifications
text: package requires specific input data columns risk calculation. demo dataset provided demonstrate expected format: Required columns include: Pregnancy details (twins, gestational age weeks) Maternal characteristics (age, height, weight, race) Medical history (chronic conditions, diabetes) Biophysical measurements (MAP, UtPI) Biochemical measurements (PlGF, PAPP-)
code: # Load the demo data demo_data <- get_demo_data() head(demo_data)

title: Data Specifications
text: data set must adhere following standards processed. calculate_pe_risk() function accepts data frame, converts row data list using row_to_list(). row_to_list() function processes standardizes specific columns. examples allowed disallowed values key columns:

previous_headings: Data Specification > Allowed and Disallowed Strings
title: Data Specifications
text: Allowed: “” → Singleton pregnancy “monochorionic” → Twins (Monochorionic) “dichorionic” → Twins (Dichorionic) Disallowed: “singleton” (use “” instead) “mono” (use “monochorionic” instead) “di” (use “dichorionic” instead)

previous_headings: Data Specification > Allowed and Disallowed Strings
title: Data Specifications
text: Allowed: “yes” → Smoker “” → Non-smoker Disallowed: “y”, “n” (use “yes” “”) “true”, “false” (use “yes” “”)

previous_headings: Data Specification > Allowed and Disallowed Strings
title: Data Specifications
text: Allowed (numeric codes): 1 → White 2 → Black 3 → South Asian 4 → East Asian 5 → Mixed Disallowed: “white”, “black” (use numeric codes)

previous_headings: Data Specification > Allowed and Disallowed Strings
title: Data Specifications
text: Allowed: “diet ” “insulin” “insulin+metformin” “metformin”, “Metformin” Disallowed: “diet” “insulin + metformin” (spaces)

previous_headings: Data Specification > Allowed and Disallowed Strings
title: Data Specifications
text: Allowed: “” → included “mom”, “MoM” → MoM (multiples median) “raw”, “Raw” → Raw values Disallowed: “none” (use “”) “median”, “raw data” (use “mom” “raw”)

previous_headings: Data Specification > Allowed and Disallowed Strings
title: Data Specifications
text: Allowed: “delfia” → Delfia machine “kryptor” → Kryptor machine “roche” → Roche machine Disallowed: “kr” (use full names)

title: Data Specifications
text: verify convert dataset appropriate format: row_to_list() function automatically handles allowed strings issues warnings invalid values detected. ensures data passed FMF preeclampsia calculator adheres required standards.
code: # Validate dataset columns validate_columns(demo_data)  # Convert a data row to a parameter list data_row <- demo_data[1, ] params <- row_to_list(data_row)

title: PERiskProfileR
text: PERiskProfileR R package designed calculate preeclampsia risk scores based first-trimester parameters using Fetal Medicine Foundation (FMF) algorithm. package provides local implementation risk calculations interface online FMF calculator.

title: PERiskProfileR
text: can install PERiskProfileR GitHub using devtools:

title: PERiskProfileR
text: data set must adhere following standards processed. Please see: Data Specifications simplicity, package includes demo data set can loaded follows: data set can act template see ow data structured.

title: PERiskProfileR
text: data set must adhere following standards processed. Please see: Data specification

title: PERiskProfileR
text: package calculates MoM values key biomarkers:
code: # Convert a data row to parameter list params <- row_to_list(demo_data[1,])  # Calculate MoMs for individual markers mom_map <- get_mom_map(params) mom_utpi <- get_mom_utpi(params) mom_plgf <- get_mom_plgf(params)  print(c(MAP_MoM = mom_map, UtPI_MoM = mom_utpi, PlGF_MoM = mom_plgf))

title: PERiskProfileR
text: Calculate preeclampsia risk using formula-based method: risk scores returned : risk_prior: Background risk based maternal characteristics risk: Final risk incorporating biomarker measurements
code: # Calculate risk for a single patient risk_results <- calculate_formula_risk(params, G = 37) print(risk_results)  # Calculate risk for multiple patients results_df <- calculate_pe_risk(   demo_data,   method = "formula",   report_as_text = FALSE,   G = 37 ) head(results_df[, c("risk_prior", "risk")])

title: PERiskProfileR
text: data set must adhere following standards processed. Please see: Data specification package can also submit data FMF online calculator:
code: # Calculate risk using online calculator online_results <- calculate_pe_risk(   demo_data,   method = "online",   save_responses = TRUE,   response_dir = "calculator_responses" )

title: PERiskProfileR
text: documentation retrieval, package can save FMF calculator response pages: saved HTML files contain: Original input data Calculated MoM values Prior final risk scores Additional details calculations
code: # Extract risk scores from saved HTML files saved_results <- extract_risk_scores_from_files(   response_dir = "calculator_responses",   report_as_text = FALSE )

title: PERiskProfileR
text: can compare results methods:
code: # Calculate risks using both methods formula_results <- calculate_pe_risk(demo_data, method = "formula") online_results <- calculate_pe_risk(demo_data, method = "online")  # Compare risk scores comparison <- data.frame(   Formula_Risk = formula_results$risk,   Online_Risk = online_results$risk ) print(comparison)

title: PERiskProfileR
text: package intended clinical use. risk calculations verified using official clinical tools. online calculator requires internet connectivity may subject rate limiting access restrictions. Note data sent external server. Always validate results ensure input data meets expected format ranges.

title: PERiskProfileR
text: package implements algorithm described : Tan , et al. Screening pre-eclampsia maternal factors biomarkers 11-13 weeks’ gestation. Ultrasound Obstet Gynecol. 2018;52:186-195.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Anders Hagen Jarmund. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Jarmund (2024). PERiskProfileR: Calculate Preeclampsia Risk Scores First Trimester. R package version 0.0.0.9000.
code: @Manual{,   title = {PERiskProfileR: Calculate Preeclampsia Risk Scores in First Trimester},   author = {Anders Hagen Jarmund},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000}, }

what: Calculate Preeclampsia Risk Scores in First Trimester
title: Calculate Preeclampsia Risk Scores in First Trimester
text: Please note: package intended clinical use user responsible use.

title: Calculate Preeclampsia Risk Scores in First Trimester
Calculate Preeclampsia Risk Scores in First Trimester
text: calculate_pe_risk() function return following values MoM UtPI MoM PlGF MoM MAP Risk score based history Combined risk score
code: # Load library library("PERiskProfileR")  # Load demo data df <- get_demo_data()  # Calculate risk scores locally result <- calculate_pe_risk(df, method = "formula")  # Calculate risk scores online. This make take some time, and note that data will be sent to the FMF web site result <- calculate_pe_risk(df, method = "online")

title: Calculate Formula-Based Risk — calculate_formula_risk
text: Calculates overall risk preeclampsia using FMF algorithm

title: Calculate Formula-Based Risk — calculate_formula_risk
text: form_data List containing required maternal characteristics measurements G Numeric, gestational age cutoff risk calculation (default: 37) report_as_text Boolean, whether return risk formatted text (default: FALSE)

title: Calculate Formula-Based Risk — calculate_formula_risk
text: List containing: mom_MAP: MAP MoM value mom_PI: PI MoM value mom_PlGF: PlGF MoM value risk_prior: Prior risk value risk: Final calculated risk

title: Calculate Online Preeclampsia Risk — calculate_online_risk
text: Submits maternal characteristics measurements Fetal Medicine Foundation's online preeclampsia risk calculator retrieves results.

title: Calculate Online Preeclampsia Risk — calculate_online_risk
code: calculate_online_risk(   form_data,   save_responses = FALSE,   response_dir = "requests",   url = "https://fetalmedicine.org/research/assess/preeclampsia/First",   row_id = NULL )

title: Calculate Online Preeclampsia Risk — calculate_online_risk
text: form_data list containing maternal characteristics measurements save_responses Boolean, whether save HTML responses (default: FALSE) response_dir String, directory path save responses (default: "requests") url String, FMF calculator URL (default: "https://fetalmedicine.org/research/assess/preeclampsia/First") row_id String NULL, identifier response file (default: NULL)

title: Calculate Online Preeclampsia Risk — calculate_online_risk
text: List containing: status: "Success" "Error" content: HTML content successful code: HTTP status code error message: Error message applicable

title: Calculate Preeclampsia Risk — calculate_pe_risk
text: Calculates preeclampsia risk multiple patients using either formula-based approach Fetal Medicine Foundation's online calculator. function processes multiple patient records returns risk scores along biomarker MoM values.

title: Calculate Preeclampsia Risk — calculate_pe_risk
code: calculate_pe_risk(   data,   id_column = "id",   method = c("formula", "online"),   report_as_text = FALSE,   G = 37,   save_responses = FALSE,   response_dir = "requests",   url = "https://fetalmedicine.org/research/assess/preeclampsia/First",   verbose = TRUE )

title: Calculate Preeclampsia Risk — calculate_pe_risk
text: data Data frame containing patient data required columns (see Details) id_column String, name column containing patient IDs (default: "id") method Character, calculation method: "formula" "online" (default: "formula") report_as_text Boolean, whether return risks text fractions (default: FALSE) G Numeric, gestational age cutoff weeks risk calculation (default: 37) save_responses Boolean, whether save online calculator responses (default: FALSE) response_dir String, directory saving responses (default: "requests") url String, FMF calculator URL (default: "https://fetalmedicine.org/research/assess/preeclampsia/First") verbose Boolean, whether show progress messages (default: TRUE)

title: Calculate Preeclampsia Risk — calculate_pe_risk
text: Data frame containing original data plus additional columns: mom_MAP: Mean Arterial Pressure MoM mom_PI: Pulsatility Index MoM mom_PlGF: PlGF MoM risk_prior: Prior risk based maternal characteristics risk: Final risk incorporating biomarkers

title: Calculate Preeclampsia Risk — calculate_pe_risk
text: Required input columns defined get_expected_columns. function supports two calculation methods: formula: Uses local implementation FMF algorithm online: Submits data FMF online calculator online method, internet connectivity required function create response directory save_responses TRUE.

title: Calculate Preeclampsia Risk — calculate_pe_risk
text: package intended clinical use. Risk calculations verified using official clinical tools.

title: Calculate Preeclampsia Risk — calculate_pe_risk
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Calculate risks using formula method results <- calculate_pe_risk(patient_data, method = "formula")  # Calculate risks using online calculator and save responses results <- calculate_pe_risk(   patient_data,   method = "online",   save_responses = TRUE,   response_dir = "calculator_responses" ) } # }

title: Get Expected Column Names — get_expected_columns
text: Returns vector expected column names preeclampsia risk calculation data, including pregnancy details, maternal characteristics, medical history, measurements.

title: Get Expected Column Names — get_expected_columns
text: Character vector containing expected column names

title: Get Expected Column Names — get_expected_columns
text: Column categories include: Pregnancy Details (twins, CRL measurements, gestational age) Maternal Characteristics (demographics, height, weight) Medical History (chronic conditions, diabetes) Obstetric History (previous pregnancies) Biophysical Measurements (MAP, UtPI) Biochemical Measurements (PlGF, PAPP-)

what: Calculate Expected Mean Arterial Pressure — get_expected_map
title: Calculate Expected Mean Arterial Pressure — get_expected_map
text: Calculates expected Mean Arterial Pressure (MAP) based maternal characteristics medical history

title: Calculate Expected Mean Arterial Pressure — get_expected_map
Calculate Expected Mean Arterial Pressure — get_expected_map
text: form_data list containing: ga: Numeric, gestational age weeks weight: Numeric, maternal weight kg height: Numeric, maternal height cm race: Integer (2=Afro-Caribbean) smoking: Boolean, smoking status chronic_hypertension: Boolean, presence chronic hypertension diabetes_type_i: Boolean, presence Type 1 diabetes diabetes_type_ii: Boolean, presence Type 2 diabetes mother_pe: Boolean, maternal history preeclampsia previous: Boolean, previous pregnancy status previous_pe: Boolean, previous preeclampsia status previous_interval: Numeric, interval since previous pregnancy years

title: Calculate Expected Mean Arterial Pressure — get_expected_map
text: Numeric value representing expected MAP

title: Calculate Expected PlGF Values — get_expected_plgf
text: Calculates expected Placental Growth Factor (PlGF) values based various maternal characteristics demographic factors. Implementation based Appendix S1 https://obgyn.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/uog.19112

title: Calculate Expected PlGF Values — get_expected_plgf
text: form_data list containing following elements: plgf_machine: Integer (1=DELFIA, 2=KRYPTOR, 3=COBAS) ga: Numeric, gestational age weeks weight: Numeric, maternal weight kg age: Numeric, maternal age years race: Integer (1=White, 2=Afro-Caribbean, 3=South Asian, 4=East Asian, 5=Mixed) smoking: Boolean, smoking status diabetes_type_i: Boolean, presence Type 1 diabetes diabetes_type_ii: Boolean, presence Type 2 diabetes conception: Integer (3=vitro fertilization) previous: Boolean, previous pregnancy status

title: Calculate Expected PlGF Values — get_expected_plgf
text: Numeric value representing expected PlGF value

what: Calculate Expected Uterine Artery Pulsatility Index — get_expected_utpi
title: Calculate Expected Uterine Artery Pulsatility Index — get_expected_utpi
text: Calculates expected Uterine Artery Pulsatility Index (UtAPI) based maternal characteristics

title: Calculate Expected Uterine Artery Pulsatility Index — get_expected_utpi
Calculate Expected Uterine Artery Pulsatility Index — get_expected_utpi
text: form_data list containing maternal characteristics including: ga: Numeric, gestational age weeks weight: Numeric, maternal weight kg age: Numeric, maternal age years race: Integer (2=Afro-Caribbean, 4=East Asian, 5=Mixed) diabetes_type_i: Boolean, presence Type 1 diabetes previous: Boolean, previous pregnancy status previous_pe: Boolean, previous preeclampsia status

title: Calculate Expected Uterine Artery Pulsatility Index — get_expected_utpi
text: Numeric value representing expected UtAPI

title: Calculate MAP MoM — get_mom_map
text: Calculates Multiple Median (MoM) Mean Arterial Pressure

title: Calculate MAP MoM — get_mom_map
text: form_data list containing: map: Numeric, measured MAP value

title: Calculate MAP MoM — get_mom_map
text: Numeric value representing MAP MoM

title: Calculate PlGF MoM — get_mom_plgf
text: Calculates Multiple Median (MoM) Placental Growth Factor (PlGF)

title: Calculate PlGF MoM — get_mom_plgf
text: form_data list containing: include_plgf: Integer (0=exclude, 1=use provided MoM, 2=calculate MoM) plgf_mom: Numeric, provided PlGF MoM include_plgf=1 plgf: Numeric, raw PlGF value include_plgf=2

title: Calculate PlGF MoM — get_mom_plgf
text: Numeric value representing PlGF MoM NA PlGF excluded

title: Calculate UtAPI MoM — get_mom_utpi
text: Calculates Multiple Median (MoM) Uterine Artery Pulsatility Index

what: PERiskProfileR: Calculate Preeclampsia Risk Scores in First Trimester — PERiskProfileR-package
title: PERiskProfileR: Calculate Preeclampsia Risk Scores in First Trimester — PERiskProfileR-package
text: package based published Fetal Medicine Foundation (FMF) Risk Calculator preeclampsia, based first trimester parameters. Risk scores can calculated either locally automatically submitting data web form.

title: PERiskProfileR: Calculate Preeclampsia Risk Scores in First Trimester — PERiskProfileR-package
text: Maintainer: Anders Hagen Jarmund anders.h.jarmund@ntnu.(ORCID)

what: Convert Data Frame Row to Parameter List — row_to_list
title: Convert Data Frame Row to Parameter List — row_to_list
text: Converts single row patient data formatted list parameters preeclampsia risk calculation, performing necessary data transformations validation.

title: Convert Data Frame Row to Parameter List — row_to_list
Convert Data Frame Row to Parameter List — row_to_list
text: row Data frame row vector containing patient data validate Boolean, whether validate column names (default: TRUE)

title: Convert Data Frame Row to Parameter List — row_to_list
text: List processed parameters appropriate types formats

title: Convert Data Frame Row to Parameter List — row_to_list
text: Performs following transformations: Calculates maternal age conception Converts categorical variables strings numeric codes Processes date fields Validates categorical inputs expected values Handles special cases diabetes medication biomarker data Input format expectations: Dates format "dd-mm-yyyy" "dd.mm.yyyy" Categorical variables (yes/) case-insensitive Twins status: "", "monochorionic", "dichorionic" Race: 1=White, 2=Black, 3=South Asian, 4=East Asian, 5=Mixed Biomarker inclusion: "", "mom", "raw" Biomarker machines: "delfia", "kryptor", "roche"

title: Convert Data Frame Row to Parameter List — row_to_list
text: function issues warnings : Missing required columns Invalid categorical values Unexpected values medical history fields Invalid biomarker specifications

title: Convert Data Frame Row to Parameter List — row_to_list
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ patient_data <- data.frame(   twins = "no",   ga = 12,   height = 165,   weight = 70,   smoking = "no",   # ... other required fields ... ) params <- row_to_list(patient_data) } # }

title: Validate Data Frame Columns — validate_columns
text: Checks data frame contains required columns preeclampsia risk calculation

title: Validate Data Frame Columns — validate_columns
text: df Data frame validate

title: Validate Data Frame Columns — validate_columns
text: List containing: valid: Boolean indicating required columns present missing_columns: Character vector missing required columns extra_columns: Character vector additional columns expected set message: Status message describing validation results
